comments:
If you rapidly click on different stack frames when debugging, you can easily 
get a
pile of "Internal error" dialogs to appear.  Below is a sample. This may be 
caused by some bug in DUI, but since I only see platform UI in the stack
trace, I'm logging it here...

NOTES:

Just wanted to confirm that this still happens in build 10182001.  It is very 
easy to reproduce, two clicks will do it.  Maybe I'm a fast clicker but this 
happens to me fairly often.

Still happens in 20011127.
I wasn't clicking fast.
In fact, I paused for a bit, and then tried to click on another stack frame.
Got the same walkback as below.
I suspect this is a dup of:
http://dev.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=1749
and:
http://dev.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=4357

20111127
Happening almost constantly now.
The debugger is in an indeterminate state, and it is doing strange things, like 
when I step into a method, suddenly I have 3 new stack frames that are 
impossible to get to.
If it helps any, I am running the usual IBM VM:
java version "1.3.0"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.3.0)
Classic VM (build 1.3.0, J2RE 1.3.0 IBM build cn130-20010502 (JIT enabled:jitc))

SWT/Workbench is doing a poor job of providing usefull debugging information in 
this case. From the stact trace it appears that some async runnable has died. 

If it's OK with you I am going to change the component of this PR to be JDT-
Debug as there are existing defects requesting better debug support for these 
types of exeptions.  See defect #6312

This was a problem with the AbstractTextEditor repositioning its cursor.
See bug 1749.
Please verify.

Verified.  Cannot get an internal errors through repeated rapid clicking of stack frames for 
different compilation units.
